num_tested_probands: The patient was the only proband tested in this case report.
No probands were tested in this study.
num_positive_het_probands: No heterozygous probands were reported to have pathogenic variants.
There are no reported heterozygous probands with pathogenic variants.
positive_phenotypes: The patient had a severe hyperkinetic movement disorder, neurodevelopmental disorder, and aminoacyl tRNA synthetase deficiency.
num_compound_or_double_hets: One compound/heterozygote mutation was detected in the WARS2 gene.
There are no reported compound or double heterozygotes.

quote_snippets: mutations in AARS2 in a series of CSF1R-negative patients with adult-onset leukoencephalopathy with axonal spheroids and pigmented glia.
the patient showed a severe hyperkinetic movement disorder with uncontrollable
the cranial magnetic resonance imaging showed gross cerebellar atrophy of both hemispheres, but no white matter lesions or signs of leukencephalopathy.
serum lactate levels were not elevated at the time of presentation and documented lactate levels during childhood ranged between 0.3 and 6.0 mmol/l
the patient received symptomatic treatment with tiapridhydrochloride up to 450 mg per day, which reduced the occurrence and the amplitude of the hyperkinetic movements and did not cause drowsiness.
no pathogenic or likely pathogenic variants were detected in the mitochondrial DNA.
this variant has been found in association with disease and is hence considered a hypomorphic allele.
severe hyperkinetic movement disorder with uncontrollable dys-tonic and ballistic movements.
He can communicate nonverbally with the parents on a basic level and react to orders.
